com.milk.uberchat.base
Class BaseLocus

java.lang.Object
  |
  +--com.milk.uberchat.base.BaseEntity
        |
        +--com.milk.uberchat.base.BaseLocus
All Implemented Interfaces:
ChatEntity, ChatLocus, Commandable
Direct Known Subclasses:
BaseChannel, BaseChannelHolder
public abstract class BaseLocus
extends BaseEntity
implements ChatLocus

This is an abstract base class that provides a lot of what all ChatLocus implementors need. It deals with the plumbing with systems and identities, and stuff like that.

Author:
Dan Bornstein, danfuzz@milk.com
, Copyright 1999 Dan Bornstein, all rights reserved.

Constructor Detail

BaseLocus

public BaseLocus(java.lang.String name,
                 java.lang.String canonicalName,
                 java.lang.String description,
                 ChatSystem targetSystem,
                 ChatIdentity targetIdentity)
Construct a BaseLocus.

Parameters:
name - the name for this locus
canonicalName - the canonical name for this locus
description - the initial description for this locus
targetSystem - the target system for this locus
targetIdentity - the target identity for this locus; if it is passed as null, then the BaseLocus being constructed must in fact be a ChatIdentity, and it will become its own target identity

getKnownUser

public final ChatUser getKnownUser(java.lang.String name)
Given a canonical name, return the user in this locus with that name, but only if the user is already known. That is, asking for the name does not imply that it should be found, and no querying of the host system should be done to satisfy this request.

Specified by:
getKnownUser in interface ChatLocus
Parameters:
name - the canonical name to look up
Returns:
the user found, or null if not

getKnownUserCount

public final int getKnownUserCount()
Return the number of currently-known users in this locus.

Specified by:
getKnownUserCount in interface ChatLocus
Returns:
the count of known channels

getKnownUsers

public final ChatUser[] getKnownUsers()
Return the list of currently-known users in this locus. That is, no querying of the host should be done to satisfy this request.

Specified by:
getKnownUsers in interface ChatLocus
Returns:
the list (array, actually) of currently-known users

addUser

protected final void addUser(ChatUser user)
Add a new user to this locus. This will automatically send out the right events to the right listeners. Also, if the target identity of this locus is also a BaseLocus and this locus is not in fact it's own target identity, then the identity will also be informed of the existence of this user. If the argument is passed as null, it is silently ignored.

Parameters:
user - null-ok; the user to add

removeUser

protected final void removeUser(ChatUser user)
Remove a user from this locus. This will automatically send out the right events to the right listeners. If the argument is passed as null, it is silently ignored.

Parameters:
user - null-ok; the user to remove

setUsers

protected final void setUsers(ChatUser[] users)
Set the user list for this locus. This will automatically send out the right events to the right listeners.

Parameters:
users - null-ok; the new user list

uberListenerAddedToUsers

protected final void uberListenerAddedToUsers(java.util.EventListener listener)
Tell all the users in this locus that an uber-listener was added to them. BaseLocus.uberListenerAdded() doesn't do this automatically since some subclasses won't want that to happen. For example, BaseChannel and BaseUser do not want to tell their users when an uber-listener is added (in the case of BaseUser, it would cause an infinite recursion!). Note that users only get informed if they are in fact subclasses of BaseEntity.

Parameters:
listener - the listener that was added

listenerAdded

protected void listenerAdded(java.util.EventListener listener)
BaseEntity calls this method when an EventListener has been added.

Overrides:
listenerAdded in class BaseEntity
Parameters:
listener - the listener that was added

uberListenerAdded

protected void uberListenerAdded(java.util.EventListener listener)
BaseEntity calls this method when an uber-listener has been added.

Overrides:
uberListenerAdded in class BaseEntity
Parameters:
listener - the listener that was added

updateUsers

public abstract void updateUsers()
Update the list of users in this locus. Subclasses should override it to do whatever they need to do to determine the current list of users and then call addUser(), removeUser(), and/or setUsers() to appropriately set things up. This should preferably happen asynchronously to the call to this method.

Specified by:
updateUsers in interface ChatLocus

speak

public abstract void speak(java.lang.String kind,
                           java.lang.String text)
Speak in this locus. Subclasses must implement this to Do The Right Thing for the actual locus in question.

Specified by:
speak in interface ChatLocus
Parameters:
kind - the kind of speech
text - the message text
See Also:
SpeechKinds

userAdded

protected void userAdded(ChatUser user)
BaseLocus calls this method when a user has been added. By default, it does nothing, but subclasses may want to override this to perform appropriate housekeeping. If this method is in fact overridden, subclasses should make sure to call super.userAdded() to make sure all the superclasses get a chance to do their respective things.

Parameters:
user - the user that was added

userRemoved

protected void userRemoved(ChatUser user)
BaseLocus calls this method when a user has been removed. By default, it does nothing, but subclasses may want to override this to perform appropriate housekeeping. If this method is in fact overridden, subclasses should make sure to call super.userRemoved() to make sure all the superclasses get a chance to do their respective things.

Parameters:
user - the user that was removed

sendInitialEvents

private void sendInitialEvents(LocusListener listener)
Send the initial set of events to a newly-added listener.

Parameters:
listener - the listener that was added
